{{Infobox NFL_season | logo = | team = Jacksonville Jaguars | year = 2009 | record = 7â9 | division_place = 4th [[AFC South]] | coach = [[Jack Del Rio]] | stadium = [[Jacksonville Municipal Stadium]] | playoffs = ''did not qualify'' | pro bowlers = '''RB''' [[Maurice Jones-Drew]] '''QB''' [[David Garrard]] | uniform = File:AFCS-Uniform-JAX.PNG }} The '''[[2009 NFL season|2009]] [[Jacksonville Jaguars]] season''' was the 15th season for the team in the [[National Football League]]. This was the first season for new general manager [[Gene Smith (American football)|Gene Smith]], who hoped to usher in a "rebuilding" era for the Jaguars franchise.{{cite web|last=Frenette|first=Gene|title=Jaguars GM Gene Smith provides hope for now and future|url=http://jacksonville.com/opinion/blog/400565/gene-frenette/2010-09-04/jaguars-gm-gene-smith-provides-hope-now-and-future|accessdate=24 October 2010}} The Jaguars improved upon their 5â11 record in [[2008 Jacksonville Jaguars season|2008]], however did not make the playoffs. The team got new uniforms for the 2009 season.{{cite web|title=AFC South | Bleacher Report |url=http://bleacherreport.com/afc-south|work=|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5icciMwmy|archivedate=2009-07-29|deadurl=no|accessdate=2009-03-24}} Team owner [[Wayne Weaver]] reportedly wanted to "clean up" the look, feeling that the team had too many uniform styles. {{TOC limit|limit=2}} ==2009 NFL Draft== {{Main|2009 NFL Draft}} {| class="wikitable" align="center" style="font-size: 95%;" |+ 2009 Jacksonville Jaguars Draft Selections |- ! colspan="2" | Draft order ! rowspan="2" | Player ! rowspan="2" | Position ! rowspan="2" | Height ! rowspan="2" | Weight ! rowspan="2" | College |- ! 53 Active, 11 Inactive, 7 PS |} == Local television blackouts == In 2009, the Jaguars had 7 of their 8 regular season home games blacked out on local TV. Due to an NFL rule, in order for a home game to be televised in a team's market, all tickets must be sold within 72 hours of kickoff. Many factors lead to a decrease in ticket sales for the Jaguars, including [[Jacksonville, Florida|Jacksonville]] being a small market, a bad local economy, and low expectations for the team coming into the season. The Jaguars drew attendances under 50,000 in their first six home games. The only game that was televised in the Jacksonville market was the final home game of the season when the Jaguars played the [[Indianapolis Colts]] on [[Thursday Night Football]]. ==Schedule== ===Preseason=== {| class="wikitable" align="center" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! rowspan="2" | Week ! rowspan="2" | Date ! rowspan="2" | Kickoff ! rowspan="2" | Opponent ! colspan="2" | Results ! rowspan="2" | Game Site ! rowspan="2" | TV ! rowspan="2" | NFL Recap |- !
